source.11fab3f0:
days_df3.plot.bar(y=['n'],alpha=0.8,figsize=(12,6))
plt.title("Case fatality after vaccination of Pfizer's in Japan (-July25) ",size=24)
plt.ylabel('days after vaccination')
plt.ylabel('cases')
plt.savefig('./pfizer.jpg')
plt.show()
source.02036478:
words=[]
for item0 in list(data['死因等\r(報告者による見解・考察等)'].unique()):
    words+=[str(item0).replace('\r','').replace('の情報に基づく','').replace('まで','').replace('不明→','')
        .replace('/','').replace('0','').replace('1','').replace('2','').replace('3','').replace('4','')
        .replace('5','').replace('6','').replace('7','').replace('8','').replace('9','').replace('()','')
        .replace('(~)','').replace('※','').replace('(万)','').replace('(~月日)','').replace('(度)','')]
words2=pd.Series(words).unique()
print(sorted(list(words2)))
source.68df871b:
query=['入浴','老衰','自殺','呼吸','心','脳','出血']
query_number=[]
for item in query:
    t=0
    for item2 in data['死因等\r(報告者による見解・考察等)'].to_list():
        if item in item2:
            t+=1
    query_number+=[t]
    
df=pd.DataFrame(query)
df[1]=query_number
df.columns=['キーワード','例数']
df1=df.sort_values('例数',ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
df1

data['days']=data['date mortality2']-data['date vaccination2']

source.a4ed83e8:
#### 資料1-3-2
## **モデルナ筋注(武田薬品工業株式会社)接種後に死亡として報告された事例**
#### 令和3年5月22日から令和3年7月30日までの報告分
source.1bc30c7f:
## Number of fatal cases was extremely high 1 day after vaccination and relatively high until 7 days after vaccination, which might indicate that these fatalities are related to vaccination. 
* If not related to vaccination, number shoud be almost constant on days. 
* Even if the relation between vaccination and fatality cannot be judged in each case, it is apparent that there is a relation between them as a whole.
* This tendency is similar to the result on 'The Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS)'.
* Check also: https://www.kaggle.com/stpeteishii/covid19-vaccination-risk/data
